title: Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference
snippet: Fabio Giglietto (Urbino) is one of the speakers at the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference, a satellite event of #AoIR2024. The conference focuses on multimodal and cross-platform CIB detection.
description: This is an announcement for the "Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference" where Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino is a speaker. The conference focuses on coordinated inauthentic behavior detection, which aligns with his research interests.

title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop - Uniurb
snippet: This paper mentions Giglietto's (2024) research, which demonstrated that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks. The research utilizes data from the Italian general elections of 2018 and 2022.
description: This paper, titled "Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop," mentions Fabio Giglietto's 2024 research on LLMs and their performance in NLP tasks, particularly using data from the Italian general elections of 2018 and 2022.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, discusses coordinated inauthentic behavior and signals for spotting misinformation. He is interviewed about how actors respond to social media platforms.
description: Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, is interviewed on a podcast about detecting disinformation campaigns, coordinated inauthentic behavior, and responses to social media platforms.

title: Presentation (Video): OpenAI Models for Topic Modelling in Social Media Analysis - Vera.ai
snippet: This page describes a presentation by Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino at the Digital Media Research Center of the Queensland University of Technology (QUT), where he discussed using OpenAI models to identify salient topics circulated via Facebook links in the lead-up to recent Italian general elections.
description: This page describes a presentation by Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino discussing the use of OpenAI models for topic modeling in social media analysis related to Italian general elections, a third-party mention of his work.

title: GENERATIVE AI AND THE MEDIA - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2025/2026 - Credits 6 - Uniurb
snippet: This is a course description listing Fabio Giglietto as the lecturer for 'Generative AI and the Media' at the University of Urbino for the 2025/2026 academic year.
description: This is a course description for 'Generative AI and the Media' at the University of Urbino for the 2025/2026 academic year, listing Fabio Giglietto as the lecturer.

title: In the Shadows of Disinformation: Fake News and Violations of Human Rights - ResearchGate
snippet: This ResearchGate document cites Giglietto et al. to define disinformation as deliberately false information with the intent to deceive.
description: A ResearchGate document citing Fabio Giglietto et al.'s definition of disinformation in the context of fake news and human rights violations. This represents a third-party citation of his work.
